fields.description:
I have the following Priorities defined in my configuration

Very High
High
Medium
Low

and in the Administrative pages, I have Medium defined as the default priority.  When I create issues using the interface, it defaults to Medium as I would expect.

However, I have PopServices defined that create issues from emails, and everything is working with the PopServices except that the issues are being created with a "High" priority instead of the defaut

Here is my Service config:

Create Issue for MAUI-OPS
com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService 	

handler:	Create Or Comment Handler
popserver:	[some-email]@uiowa.edu
handler.params:	project=MXOPS, issuetype=4, catchemail=[some-email]@uiowa.edu
usessl:	SSL (POP/S)
forwardEmail:	[some-email]l@uiowa.edu
fields.summary: PopService is not creating issues with the default priority setting

fields.description:
The default permisson for comments are "all users". It would be nice if the project administrator can specify the default group for this permission.

In our case we have a support project that contains an issue for every mail sent to the support address. We are using the Enterprise license that enables us to give the reporter the right to browse the project. In other words: the user can view it's own issues and comments. Since most of the comments are internal, and should not be viewable by the user, we have to change the group whenever we make a comment to be sure that the reporting user will not se the comment.

It would be nice if we could set the default group so that for instance all comments defaults to an internal group, but the comments that is added within a workflow transition could have another default. This would allow us to make "hidden" comments, but when resolving the issue the comment should be viewable by all so that the user will get a mail notification.

I hope this was understandable... :)
fields.summary: Selecting default "viewable by" permissions for comments

fields.description:
We are using Jira both for internal development projects and for external support. The default email templates are great for internal projects, but for some of the support projects we need custom email templates so that the different support team can ajust the content of the mail that are sent to the users.

For instance one of our projects need a template that only contain the last comment on the issue and an official support signature. This template is not useful for our internal projects since the internal team members would like to have more information about the issue and so on.
fields.summary: Custom mail templates per project

fields.description:
I am currently planning an Issue Security Scheme. As a matter of fact I change e. g. the description of a security level while I "develop" the security scheme right in JIRA (instead of using pen & paper to plan beforehand).

The problem: I cannot even edit the description anymore after I added a security level. I can only delete it and create a new one.

Current workaround (for also keep current issues assigned to this security level):

1. Create a Security Level "Tmp"
2. Delete the Security Level you want to rename or edit the description of
3. As replacement-security level select "Tmp"
4. Create the new Security Level with e. g. adjusted description.
5. Delete "Tmp" and select as replacement-security level the newly created Security Level.

... Well, quite a lot of work for such a simple task like adjusting the description...
fields.summary: It should be possible to edit Issue Security Levels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

One of my collegues pointed out to me that he uses about 3 different column layouts for his 20+ saved filters.
It would be great if one could store the column layout and assign it to filters specifically.
Therefor, a change in a column layout would only require change in one spot, not in 10 or so filters.
Is this already possible?
Thanks, Peter

fields.description:
3.4 introduces the ability to grant permissions to a User custom field, allowing individual users to be granted permissions on a per-issue basis.

This makes sense for most permissions (Browse, edit etc) but not for permissions that aren't issue-specific, ie. "Create Issue" and "Administer Project". Granting those permissions to a User custom field currently has the effect of granting 'jira-users' that permission, ie. everyone logged in can create/administer the project.
fields.summary: Granting User Custom Field "Create" or "Administer" permission grants it to everyone

fields.description:
I am using the XML view of the quick search to get a list of issues that match a filter.  If the user types in an issue number the quick search goes to the issue in a HTML view instead of the XML view i requested.  If a general search term is entered the issue navigator dispalys correctly in in XML form.

This is a typical URL that i would be generating that doesn't work:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/QuickSearch.jspa?view=rss&decorator=none&reset=true&searchString=JRA-1

This URL works:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/QuickSearch.jspa?view=rss&decorator=none&reset=true&searchString=test

I am currently working around this by checking the path of the response and the content type.  If it is not text/xml i request the current page again with the &view=rss parameter.

If it were a filter there would be no need for a special RPC servicea nd the user could create more flexible searches for watched issues.

fields.summary: Import Mantis custom fields

fields.description:
At the moment it is the select list option value that is stored in the issue instead of the option id. Thsi makes renaming options difficult.

If the custom field is used for performing searchers or statistics the value of the Select List is also used as a parameter values. If the option contains non iro-8859-1 characters these will be corrupted on most application servers (excluding Orion) as the application servers do not allow GET request parameters in other encodings.

Same problem would effect getting filter results as XML as the get request is performed then.
fields.summary: Use option ids instead of values for select list and multi select list custom fields

fields.description: In JIRA 3.4 we altered the 'mssql' database definition to increase performance (JRA-7324), but probably at the expense of breaking backwards-compatibility with SQL Server 7.  We should create a 'mssql7' database definition (in case anyone still uses it).
fields.summary: Create SQL Server 7 database definition
Allow issue operations to be governed by pluggable conditions/validators/functions as for workflow actions.
The RSS feed title for a saved filter should be the name of the filter

fields.description:
Since upgrading to 3.4.1 users have been unable to create an issue with Opera.  

In Opera, a user creates an issue, and assigns it to someone (either themselves, or anybody from the dropdown box).
However, upon clicking 'create', they then see the error 'Issues must be assigned' (see screenshot).

If they switch to IE on the same computer this works. This was previously working in both Opera and IE, in 3.3.2
fields.summary: Can't create issues in Opera

fields.description:
When no project is selected, all statuses are displayed in the Issue Navigator's Status multi-select box.

Only those associated with an Active Workflow should be displayed.

When projects are selected, only Statuses from associated workflows should be displayed (it already does this).

We will have a look at this for 3.4.2 but it may be quite a lot of work.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator should only display available statuses when no project selected

fields.description:
Currently, when viewing the dashboard, the user is presented with a warning message "Need to be logged in' in order to view particular portlets.

This looks ugly and clutters the dashboard - these portlets should be hidden quietly.
fields.summary: Do not show portlet 'Need to be logged in' message when viewing dashboard.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8586].
  {panel}

The roadmap currently displays the 'Next 3 Unreleased' versions after the currently released version.

It would be useful to also have a link to display the 'Latest 3 Unreleased' versions - i.e. the last versions added to the system.

For example, 1.0 is released. 1.0.1, 1.0.2 1.0.3 are displayed in the 'Next 3 Unreleased' roadmap.
2.0, 2.0.1 and 2.0.2 would be displayed in the 'Latest 3 Unreleased' versions.
fields.summary: Provide 'Latest 3 Versions' link on Roadmap.

fields.description:
Performing an import does not refresh dependencies in CustomFieldType objects, instead, these objects still hold a reference to the old objects. 

This has been a problem since kingdom come, but didn't present itself before since we didn't have many _stateful_ Managers that cached information and imports don't happen particularly often in live production systems. However, Caching managers like {{OptionsManager}} will behave erratically after an import.

I'll look into what's the root cause of this. From some prelim investigations, it would seem that the PluginManager may not reload the plugins after an import, while it *does* reload all the managers.
fields.summary: Performing an import does not refresh dependencies in CustomFieldType objects

fields.description:
The Issue Picker does not return correct results as the selected project ID is not set.

The problem arises in the showIssues(...) method - if the selcted project ID is not set, all issues are not shown.

The attached class can be used as a temporary workaround for JIRA 3.4.1. Please replace the original class

../java/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/issue/IssuePicker.class

with the attached version.
fields.summary: Issue Picker does not return correct results as selected project ID is not set.
CSV Export from the issue navigator

fields.description:
If you edit a field description using the Edit link in the View Field Configuraiton screen, the following happens:
Cancel --> returns you to the View Field Configuraiton screen
Update --> updates the description and takes you to the View Custom Fields screen

If you update a field from the View Field Configuraiton screen , you shold return to that screen.
fields.summary: When updating a field description from View Field Configuraiton, you are returned to the View Custom Fields screen.

fields.description: fields.validation.date.too.early = Invaid date.
fields.summary: typo in property

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to create a filter list similar to a play list in iTunes where you can add bugs.  Have the ability to add a bug to a bug list then you could share your bug lists with other users just like you can filters currently.  

Use case:
I would like to keep a list of bugs that I would like to work on or a list of bugs that I want to regularly check up on.  The list could not be generated by a search it would just be the things I have added.
fields.summary: Add user definiable bug lists similar to a play list in iTunes

fields.description:
I received an email notification that included a Due Date change. I noticed a couple things that could probably be fixed up from a cosmetic standpoint:
1) The column "Due Date" is displayed as "duedate" in the email
2) The date shows as '2005-11-21 00:00:00.0' instead of a proper date (with no time format).
I attach a screenshot of the email.
fields.summary: Notification of Due Date change has some cosmetic issues

fields.description:
We'd like to be able to define additional states for versions... right now they are hardcoded Unreleased, Released, and Closed.
In our org we additionally have "Gathering", "Frozen",  and "Certification" states as a version goes through its lifecycle.
Just as there are Issue States we can see the utility of Version States - also the ability to assign icons per state just as for Issue States.

To be really generic, it would also be great to have a workflow scheme for versioning. But that's just crazy talk.
:)
fields.summary: Custom states for versions

fields.description:
The original estimate, Time Spent and remaining estimate fields constitue a great feature of Jira. However, it should be possible to customize the way it displays in the web interface and in various exports (excel).

Examples for us: we need to know the number of days/m that need to be spent on a particular issue. The current patern is confusing (need to translate weeks into days, etc). Best would be something like 24,5 days (exported as 24,5 in excel) instead of 4 weeeks 4 days and 4 hours.

The best would be to be able to configure a pattern in some configuration file.

If I could this by myself from the source, please let me know. We use 3.4.1 Enterprise Edition.
fields.summary: TimeTracking format should be configurable

fields.description: It would often be useful to be able to package images like icons inside a plugin.  AFAIK it isn't currently possible.
fields.summary: Allow images in plugins

fields.description:
It should be possible to configure a notification scheme so that it will not send a notification to the user that triggers the notification. For instance: if I comment an issue or perform other tasks that triggers e-mail notification then I don't need an e-mail notification. 

What about a "not self" option for the notification scheme so that my self and other users don't have to use mail filters to remove mail generated by own actions.
fields.summary: E-mail notification with "not self" functionality

fields.description:
It's possible to customize which events that will trigger an e-mail notification, but it's not possible to turn off e-mail sending when a Jira account is created. 

The admin tool should have an option tu turn off this e-mail notification.
fields.summary: Turning off mail generation when account is created

fields.description:
This can be done by accessing all JavaScript and CSS files with a JIRA build number in the URL. This will force the browser to fetch the new files everytime JIRA is upgarded.

We should than write a servlet that strips the build number from the URL and forwards a request for it.
fields.summary: Ensure that clients do not need to refresh pages to get a new version of JavaScript and CSS files

fields.summary: Custom Version Field Lists Archived Versions

fields.description:
Could an additional method addWatcher( RemoteUser ) or addWatcher( RemoteUser[] ) be added to the SOAP RPC interface?

A little bit of background on the use case:
Our end users submit issues to Jira via a webform (so they don't have to deal with the complexity of Jira).  We have a servlet which takes user input, evaluates a set of rules, decides who the issue should be assigned to (and to what components etc), and creates the issue in Jira via SOAP.

Our "ruleset" currently is a bunch of ugly "if/thens" but I am exploring using a something like Drools (http://www.drools.org) to evaluate a ruleset which is in an XML file.

Anyway, we want to add a rule to our servlet which says: If an issue has a priority > X, then add my supervisor as a watcher to the issue.  Right now I'm unable to do this b/c there isn't (to my knowledge) an addWatcher() method for the IssueService.  Is that something that could be added in the near future?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add a addWatcher( RemoteUser ) and / or addWatcher( RemoteUser[] ) RPC / SOAP method
Status: Ability to delete default status not possible

fields.description:
I used the bugzilla import to import bugs from our existing Bugzilla 2.16.6 system.

We used the optional milestones feaure of Bugzilla.

The import generally went well. The import correctly imported all the Affected Version correctly. 

It also made a stab at importing the milestones (bugs.target_milestone field) as Fix Versions.

However it only did this successfully where the milestones had names that matched the versions that had bugs raised against them.

i.e. in order to get any Fix Version imported the project had to have had a with an Affected Version against the same version.

The short of this seems to be the import process is importing milestones as Fix Versions but will only use existing versions and won't create new ones.
fields.summary: Bugzilla import does not generate project version for milestone

2. The date fields are actually in Text format thus disabling the user to do any calculation or manipulation with the exported data
fields.summary: Date fields get converted to text when exported to Excel

fields.description:
If I do a search on "export data"~3 in summary, I should see issues where the summary has the word data within 3 (maybe 4) words of export. However, it finds issue JRA-7470 whose summary has 4 words in between export and data.
Also, on a related note, even though I don't specify wildcards, it appears that wildcards are implied. Otherwise, why does that search also find JRA-6121 (Cannot reload exported XML data) and JRA-2066 (Invalid XML characters when exporting data)
fields.summary: search not performing as per documented syntax

fields.description:
I have a problem using the Manage Issue Types (MIT) and Modify Issue Types Scheme (MITS) pages. The lists showing issue types ("Options" column on MIT and "Issue Types for Current Scheme" on MITS) are incomprehensible because each issue type's icon is rendered as a repeatable background for that issue type. 

Manage Issue Types:
!manageissuetypes.png!

Manage Issue Types Scheme:
!manageissuetypesscheme.png!
fields.summary: On Firefox, the Manage Issue Types GUI displays Issue Type icon as repeated background for Issue Types in the Options column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8550].
  {panel}

Permission Scheme has various actions for which it is possible to assign action permissions for specific users and/or groups.

For  "Resolve Issues" permission, the explanation is as follows : Ability to resolve and reopen issues. 

But what if, I wish to separata them? I mean I have specific case where resolve permission should be allowed to a specific group whilst reopen permission be allowed to another one...(Resolve by the designated support engineer, but Reopen by ONLY the customer)

Brief, Reopen permission is better to be provided as a separate permission level.

Hope this separation be provided soon.

Thanks
Kamil
fields.summary: Separation of Resolve and Reopen Permissions

At the moment you have to click on each single user and add or remove a certain user group from the list. This feature would really be improve the user management.

fields.description:
When setting up a Mail Server, there is a "Send Test Email" button, which in 3.4 has a "SMTP logging" option. The code supporting this breaks when an old version of JavaMail (1.2 or earlier) is present in the classloader earlier than JIRA's version (1.3.2):

{noformat}
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: javax.mail.Session.setDebugOut(Ljava/io/PrintStream;)V 
    at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.getSession(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:134) 
    at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:152)
    at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.mail.SendTestMail.doExecute(SendTestMail.java:88)
    at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
    at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:51)
    at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
    at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:178) 
    at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:802)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:252)
{noformat}

This affects app servers that don't reverse the classloader order (loading their jars before WEB-INF/lib) such as Orion.
fields.summary: Send Test Email breaks: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: javax.mail.Session.setDebugOut

fields.description:
I have added an "Assign to Reporter" post function to a transition.  When the transition takes place, the Assignee field is set to "Unassigned" instead of the Reporter.  In the General Configuration options, I have "Allow unassigned issues" turned OFF.

I have verified that this problem manifests in multiple workflow transitions on Enterprise versions 3.3.2 and 3.4.1.
fields.summary: "Assign to Reporter" post function results in issue being assigned to "Unassigned"
